trans-unit.source: Implements the `Vbc` task.
Use the `Vbc` element in your project file to create and execute this task.
For usage and parameter information, see [Vbc Task](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Vbc"></xref> class.
Fills the specified commandLine parameter with switches and other information that can go into a response file.
Command line builder to add arguments to.
Gets or sets the base address of the DLL.
The base address of the DLL.
Compiles the project through the host object.
This method will get called during execution if a host object was passed to the `Vbc` task.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if compilation succeeded; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets one or more warnings to suppress that are specified by the numeric part of the warning identifier.
Multiple warnings are separated by semicolons.
The warnings to suppress that are specified by the numeric part of the warning identifier.
Turns on documentation comments processing and gets or sets the output documentation XML file.
This property overrides the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Vbc.GenerateDocumentation%2A> property.
The output documentation XML file.
Gets or sets a string value that specifies how the task will report internal compiler errors.

This property can have the following values: - `prompt` - `send` - `none` If `prompt` is specified and an internal compiler error occurs, the user is prompted with an option of whether to send the error data to Microsoft.
If `send` is specified and an internal compiler error occurs, the task sends the error data to Microsoft.
The default value is `none`, which reports errors in text output only.
A string value that specifies how the task will report internal compiler errors.
Override Execute so that we can move the PDB file, if we need to, after the compiler is done.
Returns <xref:System.Boolean>.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether to process documentation comments to an XML file.
The name of the output XML file is the name of the executable file or the library that the task is creating.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the `Vbc` task processes documentation comments to a XML file; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns the full file path of the tool.
The full file path of the tool.
Gets or sets the item collections to import namespaces from.
The item collections to import namespaces from.
Returns a host object initialization status value that indicates what the next action should be.
This method will get called during execution of this task if a host object was passed to the `Vbc` task.
A host object initialization status value that indicates what the next action should be.
Gets or sets the language version.
Returns the language version.
This method intercepts the lines to be logged coming from STDOUT from VBC.

Once we see a standard vb warning or error, then we capture it and grab the next 3 lines so we can transform the string form the form of FileName.vb(line) to FileName.vb(line,column) which will allow us to report the line and column to the IDE, and thus filter the error in the duplicate case for multi-targeting, or just squiggle the appropriate token instead of the entire line.
A single line captured from the STDOUT of the vbc compiler
The message importance: High,Low, or Normal
Gets or sets the name of the assembly that this module will be a part of.
The name of the assembly that this module will be a part of.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the compiler should not reference the standard libraries.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the compiler should not reference the standard libraries; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the compiler should compile without a reference to the Visual Basic Runtime Library.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the compiler should compile without a reference to the Visual Basic Runtime Library; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the task will suppress all warnings.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the task will suppress all warnings; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a string value that specifies how string comparisons are made.
This property can have the following values: - `binary` - `text` The value `binary` specifies that the task uses binary string comparisons.
The value `text` specifies that the task uses text string comparisons.
The default value is `binary`.
A string value that specifies how string comparisons are made.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether explicit declaration of variables is required.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if explicit declaration of variables is required; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether to use local type inference in variable declarations.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the `Vbc` task will use local type inference in variable declarations; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the task enforces strict type semantics to restrict implicit type conversions.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the task enforces strict type semantics; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value for the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Vbc.OptionStrict*> property.
Currently, the value can be set to "custom" and specifies whether the task generates warnings for implicit narrowing type conversions.
A value for the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Vbc.OptionStrict*> property.
The path to the .Pdb file.
Returns <xref:System.String>.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether to disable integer overflow error checks.
The default value is `false`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the `Vbc` task will disable integer overflow error checks; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the root namespace for all type declarations.
The root namespace for all type declarations.
Gets or sets the location of mscorlib.dll and microsoft.visualbasic.dll.
The location of mscorlib.dll and microsoft.visualbasic.dll.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether to target the [!INCLUDE[Compact](~/add/includes/compact-md.md)].

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the `Vbc` task should target the [!INCLUDE[Compact](~/add/includes/compact-md.md)]; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the name of the tool executable file (vbc.exe).
The name of the tool executable file.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether to use the in-process compiler object, if available.
Used only by [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/add/includes/vsprvs-md.md)].

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the `Vbc` task will use the in-process compiler object, if available; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Validates input parameters and logs errors or warnings, if any.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether task execution should proceed.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if task execution should proceed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Specifies whether to compile with the default Visual Basic runtime.
Returns <xref:System.String>.
The path to the Visual Basic runtime to use.
Returns <xref:System.String>.
Gets or sets the verbosity of the compiler’s output, which can be `Quiet`, `Normal`, or `Verbose`.
The default verbosity is `Normal`.
The verbosity of the compiler’s output.
Gets or sets a list of warnings to treat as errors.
A list of warnings to treat as errors.
Gets or sets a list of warnings that are not treated as errors.
A list of warnings that are not treated as errors.
